content: these **snowflake coasters** make the perfect festive addition to any christmas table the coasters are super quick and easy to whip up & are a great way of using up scraps of cotton yarn each coaster only uses about 5g of yarn so this is a perfect stash-busting project for the festive season **gauge** gauge is not important for this project i recommend using a size down from whatever hook you would typically use for dk weight yarn i usually use a 4 00mm hook for dk yarn so for this project i ve used a 3 00mm hook the finished coasters are approx 10cm in diameter **materials** * about 5g per coaster of ***stylecraft*** **naturals organic cotton** in the shade *gypsum* 7168 50g = 104 m 114 yds or other dk weight yarn or other dk weight cotton yarn * 3 00mm crochet hook * darning needle * scissors these coasters are worked in the round starting with the magic_ring technique and working outwards to form the design a combination of double & treble crochets as well as chains and slip stitches are used the blog post contains a written pattern and photo tutorial to help make sure that every instruction is super easy to understand and follow steam blocking instructions are also included to help ensure that your coasters lie flat and smooth
